Are Black Friday deals under $50 a good value?

While most Black Friday sales tend to focus on bigger items like TVs, laptops and major appliances, there are plenty of more affordable items you can snag for less during this massive sale event. That includes everyday basics like pillows and towels, as well as more budget-friendly gadgets like smart home essentials, earbuds and small kitchen appliances, which make great gifts or stocking stuffers. You definitely don't have to spend a fortune to take advantage of Black Friday deals, and the savings add up quickly.

Where can I find the best Black Friday deals under $50?

The Black Friday deals are already in full swing at most major retailers, including Amazon, Best Buy, Target and Walmart. You can shop thousands of bargains right now, with more on the way as we get closer to the holidays. If you're on the hunt for a specific product, you'll also want to check the manufacturer's online shop as well. Plenty of brands offer their own deals for Black Friday, and you may find some direct discounts or coupon code offers that have flown under the radar and aren't being matched elsewhere.

Are Amazon's deals better than Walmart or Target?

In general, Amazon's deals may slightly outperform and result in lower prices than Walmart or Target's deals, and has the added benefit of free shipping for Amazon Prime members. But Amazon's deal values can shift throughout the day, so it's worth comparing the same products between companies to make sure you're getting the best deal. And if you have Walmart Plus, free shipping from your store is another reason to pick that retailer.

Are refurbished products worth buying under $50?

Buying refurbished products under $50 can be worth it if the deal is good enough and you won't be too worried about buying it again in the future. You won't know how much use the product will have had before getting refurbished, so stick with general use gadgets like kitchen appliances, smart speakers and other devices that can easily be swapped out in a few years. On the other hand, your refurbished item could've been quickly returned, so you might get away with a discount on an essentially unused item.
